abstract: Twitter’s offering will most likely give a boost to its hired advisers in the league tables, rankings that banks profess to ignore but nonetheless track obsessively. And landing Twitter would prove a big feather in the cap of either the New York Stock Exchange or the Nasdaq.
snippet: Twitter’s offering will most likely give a boost to its hired advisers in the league tables, rankings that banks profess to ignore but nonetheless track obsessively. And landing Twitter would prove a big feather in the cap of either the New York S...
lead_paragraph: Thanks to the social network Twitter, the league tables for initial public offerings for both banks and stock exchanges could shift significantly.

headline.main: Twitter’s I.P.O. and the League Table Fight

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced
